Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Bruce J. McGiverin: Arraignment/Detention Hearing as to Eli O. Quinones-Berrios (13) were held on 9/30/2011. Deft waived the reading of the indictment. PONG was entered as to Counts 1,2. Case is referred to Judge Gelpi for trial setting. The parties were heard as to bail. Bail is set at $15,000 ($7,500 secured by cash or real property and $7,500 unsecured), home detention, E/M, plus all other conditions as recommended by PTS. Deft shall be released once secured bond is posted and PTS is informed of landline telephone at place of residence. (AUSA Jose Capo. Atty Javier Morales-Ramos. PO Maria Goytia. Court Reporter FTR. Interpreter Felix Toledo.)(Hearing set for 10:00, held at 10:20-10:27.) (jm) (Entered: 09/30/2011)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Bruce J. McGiverin: Arraignment/Detention Hearing as to Hector Rivera-Curet (14) was held on 9/30/2011. Deft waived the reading of the indictment. PONG was entered as to Counts 1,2. Case is referred to Judge Gelpi for trial setting. The govt argued for detention. Counsel was heard as to release. Bail is set at $15,000 secured by cash/real property, with home detention, E/M, drug testing/treatment plus all other conditions as recommended by PTS. Deft shall be released once secured bond is posted and PTS is informed of landline telephone at place of residence. Deft was cautioned that a positive drug test may result in bail revocation. (AUSA Jose Capo. Atty Juan Alvarez-Cobian & student Gerard Castro. PO Maria Goytia. Court Reporter FTR. Interpreter N/A.)(Hearing set for 10:00, held at 10:20-10:30.) Gm) (Entered: 10/06/2011)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Silvia Carreno-Coll: Arraignment/Detention as to Hector Morales-Sanchez (8) Count 1,2 held on 10/19/2011. AUSA Jose Capo Vazquez and defense counsel were present. The Court finds defendant competent at this time. Defendant waived the reading of the indictment. Plea of Not Guilty is entered. Defense had no evidence to rebut the Government's presumption, but will reserve the right to reopen the matter of bail. The Court ordered defendant detained without bail pending trial. (Court Reporter FTR/bg, CD: Brenda Gonzalez, PO: Carmen Perez and Ariel Rivera.) Hearing set for 03:30. Hearing held at 04:49. Hearing ended at 04:51. Interpreter Marie Hernandez. Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Silvia Carreno-Coll: Change of Plea Hearing as to Yadira Quintero was called but not held on 3/8/2012. AUSA George Massucco and defense counsel Johnny Rivera were present. Defense counsel informed that additional time is needed and requested a continuance of the hearing. Having no objection by the Government, the Court granted the request and rescheduled the hearing. As to defendant's health issue, defense counsel informed that no action has been taken at MDC. Defendant has not been provided with medical care. The Court personally observed rash on hands. MDC has the duty to provide health care to inmates. Defendant needs to be seen by a dermatologist; needs immediate medical care. A second notice to MDC will be sent. The Court instructed counsel to call in three (3) days to notify the status of the same. Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Juan M Perez-Gimenez: Status/Scheduling Conference as to Angel Betancourt-Perez held on 8/2/2012. Present: AUSA Dina Avila and defense counsel Jose Olmo. Defense informs that plea negotiations are still ongoing. If a plea agreement is not reached disposing all three cases (CR. 10-0175, CR. 11-0181 and CR. 11-0367), the defendant will then ponder entering a straight plea. Defendant is inclined to enter a plea of guilty and not go to trial. Requests 21 days to file motion for the Court to consider all three cases as part of the same conspiracy. The Court Grants the request. Government informs that discovery has been provided and will file an opposition to the motion. Sidebar Conference held. Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Camille L. Velez- Rive:Change of Plea Hearing as to Christopher Gonzalez-Rivera(19) held on 10/22/2012. Present: AUSA Max Perez / Myriam Fernandez and defense counsel Juan Albino. Defendant present and assisted by the court interpreter. Consent to proceed before a U. S. Magistrate Judge was filed and accepted in open court. The defendant is found competent to plea. The defendant is advised of the maximum penalties he is facing, his constitutional rights, consequences of waiving his constitutional rights and the applicable statutory guidelines. The Magistrate Judge will issue a Report and Recommendation to Gustavo A. Gelpi, U.S. District Judge so that the guilty plea as to count one (1 )of the Indictment be accepted. The Court orders the preparation of the Pre- Sentence Report. Defendant to remain detained pending sentencing. Counsel was advised that if he wishes to be present during pre-sentence interview, he must make himself for such interview within 24 hours of the change of plea hearing. ORDER granting 1153 Motion to Restrict as to Javier Torres-Surin (9); granting 1154 Motion to Continue as to Javier Torres-Surin (9). Hearing will be reset. US Marshal was personally advised at 8:14 pm by the undersigned. Counsel, both for defense and government are requested in the future to make such filings early on Fridays at the latest (or earlier). But for the undersigned's soon to be discontinued habit of checking his electronic docket on Sunday evenings (because of the increasing number of weekend filings for continuances), the opposing counsel, the US Marshal, BOP and my courtroom deputy would have to preform unwarranted work tomorrow. This is not an admonition to defense counsel herein, but rather a more general statement of concern that I have. I must note that another such continuance was sought during this weekend, and in general, anywhere from 2-5 such continuances are sought on weekends. CJA counsel, the FPD and US Attorney have to keep in mind that Mondays and, if necessary Tuesdays are my sentencing days.Signed by Judge Gustavo A. Gelpi on 7/7/13. (Gelpi, Gustavo) (Entered: 07/07/2013)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Gustavo A. Gelpi:Pretrial Conference as to Christian Soto-Muyica (7) held on 6/16/2014: Present were Jose Capo-Iriarte and Atty Robert Millan. The Court inquired defense counsel as to subpoenas filed requesting three witnesses to be present to testify at the sentencing hearing. Proffer was heard, including arguments in regards to the amount of drugs. Arguments were heard from the  Government as to the evidentiary hearing held on this case were findings by the Court were made. After hearing the parties the Court ordered the Habeas Corpus to be done and the USMS to bring witnesses for the beginning of July. The Court stated for the record that the Government is free to interview the witnesses. Final Pretrial Conference set for 8/5/2014 at 9:00 AM in Old San Juan Courtroom before Judge Gustavo A. Gelpi. Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Bruce J. McGiverin: Arraignment/Bail as to Luis Silverio-Sosa (2) Count 1,2 held on 12/21/2018. Present: AUSA Myriam Fernandez, Atty. Jose R. Gaztambide, USPO Rosangela Lugo. Defendant was U/C, present in court and assisted by a certified court interpreter. Defendant was found competent to understand the proceedings. He waived the reading of the Indictment and entered a plea of not guilty as to all applicable counts. The Government has 7 days to produce discovery and the defense has 14 days thereafter to file motions. Case is referred to Judge Gustavo A. Gelpi for further proceedings. As to bail, government moved for detention. Defense counsel stated that at this time they had nothing to offer, but reserved the right to reopen the hearing. The Court granted government's motion and ordered defendant detained without bail. Order to issue.
